#include <cstdint>
#include <unordered_map>
#include <set>

typedef uint64_t obj_id_t;

// Simple LFU cache: evict the least-frequently-used (LFU) object;
// for ties, evict the least-recently-used (LRU) among them.
class CacheManager {
private:
    struct Node {
        obj_id_t id;
        uint64_t freq;
        uint64_t time;
        Node(obj_id_t i, uint64_t f, uint64_t t) : id(i), freq(f), time(t) {}
        bool operator<(const Node& o) const {
            // Set orders ascending: LFU, then LRU (smallest freq, then oldest time)
            if (freq != o.freq) return freq < o.freq;
            if (time != o.time) return time < o.time;
            return id < o.id;
        }
    };
    std::unordered_map<obj_id_t, std::set<Node>::iterator> lookup;
    std::set<Node> freq_set;
    uint64_t tick = 0;

public:
    bool find(obj_id_t obj_id) {
        auto it = lookup.find(obj_id);
        if (it == lookup.end()) return false;
        Node old_node = *(it->second);
        freq_set.erase(it->second);
        Node upd(old_node.id, old_node.freq+1, ++tick);
        auto iter = freq_set.insert(upd).first;
        lookup[obj_id] = iter;
        return true;
    }

    void insert(obj_id_t obj_id, uint64_t obj_size) {
        (void)obj_size;
        if (lookup.count(obj_id)) {
            find(obj_id);
            return;
        }
        Node n(obj_id, 1, ++tick);
        auto iter = freq_set.insert(n).first;
        lookup[obj_id] = iter;
    }

    obj_id_t evict() {
        if (freq_set.empty()) return 0;
        auto victim = freq_set.begin();
        obj_id_t vid = victim->id;
        freq_set.erase(victim);
        lookup.erase(vid);
        return vid;
    }
};

#include <cstdint>
#include <unordered_map>
#include <set>

typedef uint64_t obj_id_t;

// Slightly favor LRU over LFU for improved recency on ties
class CacheManager {
private:
    struct Node {
        obj_id_t id;
        uint64_t freq;
        uint64_t time;
        Node(obj_id_t i, uint64_t f, uint64_t t) : id(i), freq(f), time(t) {}
        bool operator<(const Node& o) const {
            // Set orders ascending: LFU, then LRU (most recently used LAST among equal freq)
            if (freq != o.freq) return freq < o.freq;
            if (time != o.time) return time > o.time; // now most recently used will be last evicted
            return id < o.id;
        }
    };
    std::unordered_map<obj_id_t, std::set<Node>::iterator> lookup;
    std::set<Node> freq_set;
    uint64_t tick = 0;

public:
    bool find(obj_id_t obj_id) {
        auto it = lookup.find(obj_id);
        if (it == lookup.end()) return false;
        Node old_node = *(it->second);
        freq_set.erase(it->second);
        Node upd(old_node.id, old_node.freq+1, ++tick);
        auto iter = freq_set.insert(upd).first;
        lookup[obj_id] = iter;
        return true;
    }

    void insert(obj_id_t obj_id, uint64_t obj_size) {
        (void)obj_size;
        if (lookup.count(obj_id)) {
            find(obj_id);
            return;
        }
        Node n(obj_id, 1, ++tick);
        auto iter = freq_set.insert(n).first;
        lookup[obj_id] = iter;
    }

    obj_id_t evict() {
        if (freq_set.empty()) return 0;
        // Use rbegin to evict the least frequent, most recently used among ties
        auto victim = --freq_set.end();
        obj_id_t vid = victim->id;
        freq_set.erase(victim);
        lookup.erase(vid);
        return vid;
    }
};
